summary: Shift WishMint AI toward a production-ready, scalable premium monetized birthday/emotional message platform with Razorpay subscriptions (India payments), tiered plans (Free/Pro/Creator) with automatic feature locking, enhanced export formats (PNG/PDF/MP4), Surprise Link experiences, voice + reel generation, conversion-focused homepage updates, user dashboard, and creator marketplace upgrades including payouts/analytics‚Äîpotentially requiring an online backend stack beyond the current offline-first IC-only approach.
architectural_notes: Single-file offline-first implementation: all HTML/CSS/JS in one index.html; template-based text generation (no external APIs/keys).
Use wa.me URL with encodeURIComponent for WhatsApp sharing.
Use HTML canvas rendering for downloadable share card images.

Google Sign-In/OAuth requires external network access and third-party integration; this may conflict with fully offline-first/no-external-dependency goals and needs an explicit decision on allowed online-only features.
Relax gated UX flow: generation is allowed without login; only saving, premium template exports, and advanced features require authentication.
Add QR code generation locally (client-side) with no external API dependencies to preserve offline-friendly behavior.
Add SEO meta tags (title/description) directly in index.html head.
User chose Option 2: implement the premium Canva/Instagram-style card system as a separate standalone card designer module inside the app (not just upgrading the existing card output flow).

Google Analytics (gtag.js) requires loading scripts from googletagmanager.com; this introduces an external network dependency and may conflict with offline-first/no-external-dependency goals‚Äîdecide whether analytics is allowed as an online-only enhancement.
Razorpay subscriptions require online backend components: subscription creation, webhook verification, and secure server-side signature checks; cannot be fully offline-first.
known_issues: Deployment/build error encountered when attempting to push/deploy the app to the network.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page React UI for ‚ÄúWishMint AI‚Äù with a premium dark theme and neon gradient accents (purple + green), using clean typography, rounded cards, subtle shadows, smooth spacing, and mobile-first responsive layout suitable for India audiences on phones and desktop.
Implement minimal premium animations for key section reveals and interactions (fade/slide), ensuring animations are subtle and do not block interaction or significantly impact performance.

Add a Hero section with title ‚ÄúWishMint AI‚Äù, subtitle ‚ÄúMake birthdays feel personal in seconds.‚Äù, and two CTAs: primary ‚ÄúGenerate Wish‚Äù (scrolls/focuses generator) and secondary ‚ÄúSee Examples‚Äù (scrolls to examples/gallery).

Build the core Generator section with the specified inputs: Name (required), Your name (optional), Relationship dropdown (friend, best friend, mom, dad, brother, sister, girlfriend, boyfriend, crush, teacher, colleague), Tone dropdown (emotional, funny, romantic, formal, short & sweet, light roast), Language dropdown (English, Hinglish, Hindi), Personality dropdown (kind, fun, hardworking, cute, savage, supportive, creative, introvert), and an optional memory textarea labeled ‚ÄúAdd 1 personal memory line (optional)‚Äù.

Add generator actions: ‚ÄúGenerate‚Äù, ‚ÄúSurprise Me (randomize)‚Äù, ‚ÄúCopy All‚Äù, and ‚ÄúShare on WhatsApp‚Äù. Implement basic validation so Generate/Copy/Share requires Name; show a clear inline error when missing.

Implement template-based (non-AI) ‚ÄúBirthday Pack‚Äù generation on the client with modular JavaScript/TypeScript functions. Generation must produce 5 outputs: Main Wish, WhatsApp Short, Instagram Caption, Mini Speech (targeting 10‚Äì15s spoken length), and Hashtags, varying based on relationship, tone, language, personality, and optional memory line.

Create an Output section that displays 5 output cards titled: ‚ÄúMain Wish‚Äù, ‚ÄúWhatsApp Short‚Äù, ‚ÄúInstagram Caption‚Äù, ‚ÄúMini Speech (10‚Äì15s)‚Äù, and ‚ÄúHashtags‚Äù. Each card must include a ‚ÄúCopy‚Äù button that copies only that card‚Äôs content.

Implement ‚ÄúDownload as Card Image‚Äù that renders a shareable card using HTML canvas (no external API keys). The exported image must include: WishMint AI branding, selected template style, and the generated Main Wish (and optionally recipient name). Allow downloading as a PNG file.
Add an Examples/Gallery section showing 6 sample wishes covering different tones and relationships, with a tone filter that updates the displayed examples.

Add a Templates section (MVP) that displays 8 selectable card templates: Minimal, Cute, Luxury, Anime, Neon, Classic, Aesthetic, Funny. Selecting a template changes the styling used to preview the generated wish and is also used by the ‚ÄúDownload as Card Image‚Äù export.

Add a Pricing section with clearly presented tiers: Free (text generation + copy/share) and Pro (unlimited templates + export card image + premium styles), plus a ‚ÄúFuture‚Äù subsection listing voice wishes and video slideshow as future features (non-functional).
Add an FAQ section covering: privacy, how it works, language support, and how to share. Content must be in English.
Add a Footer with Privacy Policy, Terms, and Contact links/sections. Provide simple on-page sections or anchor links (no external dependencies required).

Keep the app fast and offline-friendly by avoiding external API calls for core functionality and ensuring the app works without network access after being loaded once. All generation logic must be local.
Add a built-in set of selectable birthday card background images (a small gallery) that can be used as the background for the card preview and the exported PNG card.
Store the generated birthday card background images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the UI and export logic by file path.

Update the template selection UI to visually display the birthday card background images as selectable thumbnails (in addition to, or replacing, the current gradient-only previews) and clearly indicate the currently selected background.

Update the card export implementation to render the selected birthday card background image onto the canvas before drawing text and branding, while preserving the existing text wrapping and downloadable PNG behavior.

Implement a user login/logout UI using the existing Internet Identity authentication hook, and present it to users as the app‚Äôs Google-based login alternative (since direct Google OAuth is not supported in this stack).
Display basic authenticated user info in the UI after login, using the active identity principal as the user identifier, and keep the app usable when not logged in.
Add a minimal backend method to verify authentication wiring by returning the caller principal, and ensure the frontend can call it using the authenticated actor when logged in.

Enforce a gated flow so users must be authenticated (Internet Identity) before they can generate birthday wishes or use generator actions (Generate, Surprise Me, Copy All, Share on WhatsApp). If the user is not signed in, keep the generator section visible but disabled and show a clear inline message prompting the user to sign in.

Add a required plan-selection step after login: authenticated users must select a plan (Free or Pro) before generator actions become enabled. Store the selected plan locally and show the currently selected plan in the UI.

Update the Pricing section so its plan CTAs function as plan selection controls: clicking the Free CTA selects Free; clicking the Pro CTA selects Pro. The UI must clearly indicate the selected plan state and provide a way to proceed to generation (e.g., scroll to the generator after selection).

Ensure Hero section primary CTA ("Generate Wish") respects the gated flow: if the user is not logged in, it should prompt sign-in instead of scrolling directly into an unusable generator; if logged in but no plan selected, it should scroll to Pricing and prompt plan selection; otherwise it scrolls to the generator and focuses the Name input.
Add a top-left corner credit label that reads exactly "Created By Arion Zi" in the top bar of the Hero section, aligned opposite the existing authentication controls.

Apply a UI polish pass to make the website look more professional by improving consistency of spacing, typography hierarchy, and alignment across major sections (Hero, Generator, Templates, Pricing, Examples, FAQ, Legal, Footer) without changing any existing feature behavior or gated-flow logic.

Remove the login/plan gating barrier for core wish generation so that anonymous users can generate and use generator actions (Generate Wish, Surprise Me, Copy All, Share on WhatsApp) without signing in or selecting a plan, while keeping the app functional for authenticated users.

Upgrade the Hero section to include (1) an animated emotional tagline that reads exactly ‚ÄúCreate birthday wishes that feel handwritten and personal.‚Äù, (2) a small demo preview card showing a sample generated wish under the hero content, and (3) trust badges for ‚ÄúFree AI Generator‚Äù, ‚ÄúInstant Results‚Äù, and ‚ÄúMulti Language Support‚Äù, while keeping the existing ‚ÄúWishMint AI‚Äù title and premium dark gradient look.

Add two new generator controls: a Wish Length slider and an Emoji Level slider, and incorporate them into local template-based generation so the generated outputs vary based on these settings (longer/shorter content and more/fewer emojis).
Enhance the Output section so each of the 5 output cards includes both a Copy button and a Share button, and add smooth, subtle interaction animations for output cards and actions.

Add an ‚ÄúInstagram Story‚Äù export format option for card downloads in addition to the existing square export, and gate card image download/export behind authentication as a premium/advanced feature (anonymous users can still generate and share text).
Implement a local, offline QR code generator feature as a social/viral tool, allowing users to generate a QR code from shareable content derived from the generated wish pack (no external QR APIs).

Add a new ‚ÄúFeatures‚Äù (feature explanation) section that uses icons and short English descriptions for: AI Emotional Writing, Memory Based Wishes, Instant Share Tools, Multi Language Support, and Personal Tone Customization.
Add a Testimonials section with clearly labeled demo/fake testimonials (English) to improve trust, styled consistently with the existing premium theme.
Apply SEO improvements by setting the document meta title to "WishMint AI ‚Äì AI Birthday Wish Generator" and meta description to "Generate emotional, funny, romantic AI birthday wishes instantly.".
Update the footer and on-page link targets to include an ‚ÄúAbout WishMint AI‚Äù link/section alongside Privacy Policy, Terms, and Contact, with all user-facing text in English.

Add a ‚ÄúSave Wish‚Äù capability as a logged-in advanced feature: authenticated users can save a generated Birthday Pack and view a list of their saved wishes; anonymous users cannot save and are prompted to sign in when they try.
Identify and fix the root cause of the current deployment error so the project can successfully build and deploy to the Internet Computer network.

Add or repair missing/incorrect Internet Computer project configuration required for deployment (for example: canister configuration and frontend asset build integration) so the deployment pipeline has all required files and settings.
Ensure any user-facing error messaging shown during build/deploy troubleshooting (if surfaced in the app UI or logs) is in English and is actionable (states what failed and what to try next).
Implement a pre-login ‚ÄúDemo mode‚Äù so anonymous users can try generating a Birthday Pack without signing in or selecting a plan.
Update generator gating logic so authentication/plan gating does not block Demo mode, while keeping existing authenticated flows intact.
Add a demo-friendly onboarding experience that pre-fills the generator with a realistic example and generates outputs automatically when Demo mode is started.
Gate advanced/auth-only actions appropriately during Demo mode and show clear English prompts when an action requires sign-in.
Ensure the Hero section‚Äôs prompts and CTAs support the pre-login demo flow in addition to sign-in.

Create a separate, standalone ‚ÄúPremium Card Designer‚Äù module inside the existing WishMint AI React app (Option 2) that is clearly distinct from the current Templates/Output card preview and can be entered from the main flow after a birthday pack is generated.

In the Premium Card Designer module, implement a template/theme selection step before showing the final designed card, offering these themes: Cute Pastel, Romantic Love, Minimal Luxury, Neon Party, and Anime/Aesthetic, each with premium styling (backgrounds, typography, and decorative vibe) consistent with the theme name.

Add an interactive customization panel within the Premium Card Designer module that allows the user to customize: background style, font style, font color, text alignment, emoji decoration toggle, border style, and an animation toggle.

Implement premium visual treatment for the Premium Card Designer card preview to look like an Instagram/Canva-style greeting card, including: animated gradient background option, glassmorphism card styling option, card shadow/glow controls (or theme defaults), and decorative emoji elements placed around the card when enabled.

Add an animated card preview experience in the Premium Card Designer module when the card is generated/opened, including: fade-in animation, floating emoji animation (when enabled), and a smooth text scroll/entrance animation (when enabled), while respecting reduced-motion preferences.

Add photo support in the Premium Card Designer module so a user can add a photo to the birthday wishes card using a local file upload, then position it within the card design in a simple, mobile-friendly way (e.g., preset placements such as ‚ÄúTop‚Äù, ‚ÄúCenter‚Äù, ‚ÄúBottom‚Äù or draggable placement if already supported by existing patterns).

Add social export actions within the Premium Card Designer module: Download as Instagram Story (9:16), Download as Image, Share on WhatsApp, Share on Instagram, and Copy Text; ensure the exported Instagram Story format uses a 9:16 canvas/layout and that export works fully offline after first load.

Extend the existing canvas export pipeline so the Premium Card Designer can export images that reflect the new designer state (theme + customization options + optional user photo), without breaking the current exportCardImage behavior used by OutputSection.

Add ‚ÄúFuture ready‚Äù placeholders within the Premium Card Designer module UI for: AI voice message card, Birthday video slideshow card, and Memory photo collage card, implemented as non-functional placeholders with clear English copy indicating they are coming soon.
Add a new ‚ÄúCommunity‚Äù section where users can publish templates or stickers so others can browse, view details, and subscribe/follow creators to build an audience.

Add a new ‚ÄúMarketplace‚Äù section enabling buy-and-sell listings for templates/stickers (MVP): users can create listings, browse/search listings, and express intent to buy without integrating payments.

Integrate the new Community and Marketplace sections into the existing navigation/scroll flow and keep styling consistent with the current premium dark + neon theme, using existing UI components and animations.

Promote the currently deployed ‚ÄúDraft Version 11‚Äù build to a public/production release for WishMint AI, ensuring end users no longer see any draft-only labeling or draft-only behavior in the UI or deployed assets for Version 11.
Add the provided Google Analytics gtag.js tracking snippet to the site HTML so it loads on every page view, using measurement ID G-ZPB7R21LJ4.

Update the deployed frontend Content Security Policy (CSP) configuration to allow loading and using Google Analytics resources required by gtag.js, without breaking existing Internet Identity and app functionality.

Update the plan model used by the app to support three plans (Free, Pro, Creator) and plan entitlements required for feature locking: Free (3 messages/day, watermark on downloads, limited templates, no HD export), Pro (‚Çπ49/month: unlimited messages, no watermark, HD export 1080x1080 + 9:16, premium templates, Hindi + Romantic tone access, Surprise Link generation), Creator (‚Çπ149/month: everything in Pro + creator marketplace selling features, analytics dashboard placeholder). All user-facing text must be in English.

Implement message quota enforcement for the Free plan: limit to 3 message generations per calendar day. For anonymous users, enforce using localStorage per-device; for authenticated users, enforce using backend storage keyed by principal. When the limit is reached, block generation actions and show a clear English prompt to upgrade.

Add a Razorpay upgrade entry-point in the Pricing section UI for Pro and Creator plans that starts a client-side payment flow (placeholder/stub if full Razorpay verification cannot be completed in this environment). The UI must clearly indicate that payments are processed via Razorpay and must not break offline core generation.

Implement entitlement-based feature locking UX across the app: if a feature is not included in the user‚Äôs current plan, render it blurred/disabled, show a ‚ÄúUnlock Premium‚Äù button, and open a pricing comparison modal when clicked. Include the upgrade CTA text exactly: ‚ÄúCreate Something She Will Never Forget üíñ‚Äù.

Update the download/export system to support plan-based behavior: Free users can download with a watermark; Pro/Creator users can download without a watermark and in HD (1080x1080) and 9:16. Keep the existing canvas-based export behavior intact and extend it to apply watermarking and size selection where applicable.

Add PDF download option for generated content (at minimum: the Main Wish plus WishMint AI branding). Gate PDF HD/no-watermark variants behind Pro/Creator where applicable, and apply watermarking for Free.

Implement ‚ÄúSurprise Mode‚Äù (Pro/Creator only) that generates a private link to a dedicated Surprise view. When opened, the page plays: animated confetti, a name reveal animation, romantic background music (toggleable/mutable), and a message fade-in animation. Store the surprise payload so the link can render without requiring the generator form on open.

Improve the homepage for conversion: change the Hero primary CTA label from ‚ÄúTry Demo‚Äù to exactly ‚Äú‚ú® Create Magic Now‚Äù; add a social proof counter reading exactly ‚Äú3,000+ Wishes Generated Today‚Äù; add a premium badge UI element; and add a pricing comparison table section (can be integrated into the pricing modal and/or pricing section).

Add an authenticated user dashboard section accessible after login that displays: subscription status/plan, remaining free credits (if on Free), download history, saved templates, and (if on Creator) an earnings panel (placeholder if full payouts are not implemented).

Upgrade Marketplace capabilities for Creator plan: restrict creation of marketplace listings to Creator users (Free/Pro users can browse), and add creator-facing tracking of listing downloads (or expresses-interest interactions if downloads are not implemented) in the dashboard.

Add/expand legal and trust content sections to include Terms & Conditions and Refund Policy in addition to existing Privacy Policy and Contact. Ensure all user-facing text is in English and matches the site‚Äôs premium dark gradient style.
